events.name: Simulation 101: Achieve Maximum Cost Savings on Physical Prototyping by Testing Your Models Digitally
events.description:

Validate product performance and safety while you design?


Investigate the impact of a moving liquid or gas on product performance?


Calculate temperate distribution within a solid structure?


    
Join us to find out about Simulation 101:  


Calculate stresses and deformations of parts and assemblies due to internal / external loads

events.name: Hyper Island Open House: Change Your Tomorrow
events.description:
It's time! The Hyper Island Open House 2015 is here! Our Theme is Change Your Tomorrow.  The world is changing, and the change happens now, not in the future. Change today in order to be ready for the future tomorrow. During our Open house, we will have a series of workshops and speaker sessions, our Alumni and current students will share their stories, our staff will share their knowledge, and you will get some tools in order to change YOUR tomorrow. Do come by anytime between 12pm and 4pm. We look forward to meeting you in our space! 
Schedule: 

The Hyper Island Way by Christina Andersson
Workshop: What Will You Change Tomorrow? by Christina Andersson
Why E-commerce in China is even more important than it appears by Jonathan Briggs
MA Stories: A look into some of our Masters students at Hyper Island by Paviter Singh
Workshop: API Mashup  by Jakob Widerberg
events.location: Hyper Island in Singapore, 991B Alexandra Road #03-08/11, Singapore 119970

events.name: Front End TL;DR January 2015
events.description: Double whammy to usher in the new year! We're being hosted by 99.co (also known for Homie) and Carousell at their shared office space. Drop by to get to know these two rocketing local-grown startups. FEDS TL;DR is all about hands-on learning. Make new friends and explore some intriguing bit of front end tech you always wanted to try. Satisfaction guaranteed. Schedule: Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. 7:00pm — Arrival, registration, seating 7:10pm — Intro talk 7:30pm — Teams work on mini challenges 8:30pm — Presentations, awards 9:00pm — The end. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/ PS: Bring a laptop and show up a bit earlier to get set up on the wifi.
events.location: 99.co

events.name: Singapore Gophers January Meetup
events.description: Happy New Year Gophers! Hope you are excited for the first meetup of the 'Year of Gopher' (http://twitter.com/davecheney/status/550276404026150912). Here's the line-up for the Meetup: * Customising Your Own Web Framework in Go Jonathan Gomez, Engineer @ Zumata At Zumata we use Go in our main API. We've chosen a mix of using the Go standard library and bite-sized open-source components (i.e. handling routing/middleware/persistence), rather than adopting a fuller web framework, or relying purely on the standard lib. This talk outlines our experiences, and aims to help you get started building and structuring your APIs in Go. * Adventures in IoT with Golang Lakshan Perera & Audrey Lim Sharing our little experiments in trying to power anything and everything with Go. * Pop Quiz (10-20 mins) We are introducing a new segment from this year, so come prepared to write code (bring your laptop or a pen & paper) As usual, there will be pizza.
events.location: Nitrous IO, 1 Trengganu St, 2nd Floor, Singapore 058455, Singapore

events.name: Hello, World! in Drupal 8 and Open Space
events.description: This month's presentation is an introduction to developing in Drupal 8 where Joe Chin will go through the steps of creating a simple "Hello, World!" module and theming it up. After the presentation, which should last about an hour, we will go into an Open Space format where you can bring up your biggest Drupal gripe, most awesome module or coolest theme for discussion. And, as always, after the meetup, we will gather downstairs at the food court for food, drinks and (usually) good conversations until the wee hours of the night :) About Joe Chin Joe has been a long time big Drupal fan. He has done so many projects with Drupal from personal website to professional. Joe is also very active in Drupal Community, and been presenting lots of talks in many Drupal events through out South East Asia. Directions Smartspace is located at 261 Waterloo Centre #03-32 or #03-36. Easiest way to reach the unit: 1. locate the foodcourt on the ground floor 2. take the wide staircase to level 3 3. at level 3, go straight, turn right, you'll see unit #03-32 4. ring the door bell if the door is locked If you're lost, get in touch with SJ @[masked] / Kiat @[masked] 956. And there will be free Pizzas and Cokes too for attendees.
events.location: SmartSpace, 261 Waterloo Street, #03-32, Singapore 180261

events.name: WAWS - January 2015 Meetup - Event Placeholder
events.description: Hi Guys, Happy New Year! Not long now until next week's meetup and we are really excited to announce our first speaker for 2015! The first talk on the night will be: A/B Testing and the most common problems, a look at statistics and the ways to get it wrong Nikolay Novozhilov - Product director of data platforms @ Wego.com . Nikolay is building big data capabilities at Wego.com , the Asia Pacific and the Middle East's leading travel metasearch engine. He has 7+ years of experience in data analytics working for IT startups and previously for consulting. Nikolay received an MBA from INSEAD in Singapore and before that lived and worked in Moscow. Talks will start @ 7:00pm however we will be kicking off drinks from 6:30pm so come in early and join us for a drink and a chat before hand if you are free! As always we will have free beers and snacks available on the night. Regards, WAWS!
events.location: Hood Bar and Cafe @ Bugis+ (formerly Iluma), Bugis+, 201 Victoria Street, #05-07, Singapore 188067

events.name: 5th ASEAN "Bridges" Speaker Series - Professor Brian P Schmidt, 2011 Nobel Laureate for Physics
events.description:
Keynote speaker: 
Professor Brian P Schmidt is a 2011 Nobel Laureate for Physics at the Australian National University. In 1994, Professor Schmidt and Professor Nicholas Suntzeff formed the HighZ SN search team, a group of 20 astronomers on five continents who used distant exploding stars to trace the expansion of the Universe back in time. The group’s discovery of an accelerating Universe was a startling one suggesting that an unknown force is countering the effect of gravity and pushing the Universe apart.  
Professor Schmidt continues his work using exploding stars to study the Universe, and is leading Australian National University’s Research School of Astronomy and Astrophysics’ effort to build the SkyMapper telescope. 
Jointly hosted by NUS and Yale-NUS College, this public lecture is part of the International Peace Foundation’s “Bridges – Dialogues Towards a Culture of Peace” speaker series at NUS. 

  
“Science: Humanity’s Universal Bridge”  
Science is one of the few arenas where humanity has worked together through history for our collective good. In his speech, Professor Schmidt will discuss the role of science through the ages in shaping our current society, reflecting on the good and the bad its knowledge has brought. While science's impact in our daily lives is higher now than ever before, to cope with future challenges the world will need further improve how it works together. It is through continual advances in our knowledge that we can hope to have the billions of the world's inhabitants live in peace and prosperity into the future.
events.location: Shaw Foundation Alumni House Auditorium, Level 2, 11 Kent Ridge Drive, Singapore 119244

events.name: Introducing Application Security in Your Organization - Think Like a Developer
events.description: In this session, the speaker, Sandeep Nain, from HP Australia and a former co-lead from OWASP Melbourne Chapter, will cover the following topics: 1. How to build secure development lifecycle for development teams using modern software development methodologies 2. Challenges of enforcing secure development lifecycle at an enterprise scale 3. Reasons why most application security programmes fail and how we can collaborate with development teams for easier enterprise adoption Come join us for our 1st 2015 meetup which comes with free pizzas and soft drinks, courtesy of HP Fortify. PS: Please take note of our new meeting place in NUS.
events.location: Seminar Room 10, COM1 Building #02-10, 13 Computing Drive, NUS, Singapore 117417

events.name: "Future Cities: Research in Action"@Urban Lab
events.description:
Join us for the launch of Urban Lab, a new dedicated exhibition space by URA that profiles innovative solutions for a sustainable and liveable urban environment. Urban Lab will open with its inaugural exhibition, ‘Future Cities: Research in Action’ by Future Cities Laboratory of the Singapore-ETH Centre. This presents transdisciplinary research on cities, urbanisation and global environmental sustainability, and explores the challenges and opportunities facing cities today. Come and find out how science, design and technology are helping to create a more sustainable and liveable urban future!   
  
FAQs 
1. What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
By public transport, the nearest MRT station is Tanjong Pagar MRT Station. Please use Exit A and walk along Peck Seah Street.  
By car, you may park at the URA East Wing car park. Please use the lift to access the link bridge on the second floor. Follow the signs for Singapore City Gallery, and take the escalator to the first floor.    
2. Is my invitation transferrable? 
Yes, in the event that you are unable to attend you may nominate someone to take your place. Please kindly inform the organisers. 
3. Do I have to bring my printed invitation to the event? 
No, you do not need to bring your invitation to the event.
events.location: Urban Redevelopment Authority, The URA Centre Atrium, 45 Maxwell Road, Singapore 069118
events.group_name: Urban Redevelopment Authority and Singapore-ETH Centre

1. Generate Innovative Designs Faster

Coordinated BOM

events.name: Using Freelancers to grow your business - Elance-oDesk
events.description:
Thousands of Singapore-based companies are already growing their business using the technical, creative, and sales talent found on oDesk.  
You’re invited to join a hands-on training on Monday, January 26th. Learn how to hire a qualified developer to build your mobile app, work with a graphic designer to update your website, or find a talented sales representative that can add value to your funnel.  
● Find an area of your business that can be easily tasked to a freelancer 
● Create a job post that gets noticed   
● Choose the right freelancer at the right price 
● Communicate and complete your project  
Plus we’ll divulge some best practices from our most successful clients. 
What is Elance-oDesk? 
Elance-oDesk is the global leader in online work – our sites Elance.com and oDesk.com help businesses find freelancers and work together via the Internet. We can help connect you with qualified designers, writers, marketers and mobile app developers. If the work can be done online, you can find someone to help you on Elance-oDesk. On our platform we have: 
● 2.7M+ jobs posted annually 
● Over 2,600 skills - from web development to social media to virtual assistants 
● Freelancers in over 180 countries 
Find out why 86% of companies believe that business hiring online will soon be common  -- and see exactly how it’s done. Plus we’ll divulge some best practices from our most successful clients. 
  
It’s your chance to ask questions and get hands-on help from your local Startup Mobilizer, Jerry Koedding.
events.location: The Hub, 113 Somerset Rd, Singapore 238165

events.name: DataScience SG Meetup- Jan
events.description: Hi everyone, happy new year to all of you from us organizing committees at DataScience SG. We look forward to a fruitful and exciting 2015 with all you. To start off the year, we have lined up 2 speakers in our January meetup =) 7.15 pm: Networking (BYOR- Bring Your Own Refreshments =) 7.30 pm: Nicholas Jachowski (linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/pub/nicholas-jachowski/b/937/805 ) 8:00 pm: Sutowo Wong (linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/sutowo ) • Title: Common Misconceptions in Analytics • Synopsis: When it comes to learning about Analytics, most people think of classroom training. The value of getting your hands dirty and especially learning from mistakes is often overlooked. The presentation that you see is often the result of many rounds of scrubbing. The speaker will share some of the common mistakes that he has observed and provide a glimpse of the working drafts before they were scrubbed and polished. He will also talk about the critical success factors that will make or break Analytics implementation. 8:30 pm: Closing and networking. More details on the talk will be updated. Stay tuned to our meetup page.
events.location: SMU School of Economics and Social Science, Seminar Room 5.2 (lift access only), Singapore Management University

events.name: Innovation. Not infrastructure.
events.description: Happy 2015 everyone! The first meetup of the year is here! We are combining the meetup this month with a Google Cloud Platform event around staying agile with infrastructure and adapt to changes happening in the space. Below are the talks scheduled for the event 1. 'Fat-free Compute Infrastructure' - a talk around Apache Mesos by Abhishek Parolkar, Head of Technology @ PropertyGuru 2. 'Warehouse Style Computing, Working with Custers as an abstraction' a talk about containerisation and Kubernetes by Karthikyan Rajasekharan, Technical Lead @ Google Cloud Platform Asia 3. You? ************ Call for speaker ************ There is a 20 minutes slot available for a talk around similar topic like containerization. Ping us at sagarwal@thoughtworks.com or tth@thoughtworks.com. ************ Job Postings ************ If you are looking for people, message us a blurb (keep it short please) and a link to your job posting and we will put it here. 1. ThoughtWorks ThoughtWorks is synonymous with innovation. We are dedicated to the art of perfecting software delivery by keeping it lightweight, fast-moving and open-source. Our clients are people and organisations with ambitious missions - whether in the commercial, social, or government sectors. They trust us to deliver the disruptive thinking and technology that empowers them to succeed. We are currently looking for talented people in Singapore/ASEAN who are equally as passionate about software. If you are someone who loves the idea of helping the technical community locally to grow then we want to talk to you! https://jobs.thoughtworks.com/singapore/JobDetail/Singapore-Singapore-Software-Developers/897 P.S. Please carry an ID to exchange for a pass at the reception to gain access to the building. Thank you to Google for providing the venue and food/drinks.

events.name: It's 2015 let's start something - GeekGirl Meetup Launch and Startup Stories from Singapore
events.description:
It's 2015 - let's start something 
  
Geek Girl Meetup Launch Event:  
Startup Stories from Singapore 
  
28 January, 2015 | 6.30pm - 9.30 pm | The Working Capitol 
  
Geek Girl Meetup, the global community for women intrested in tech, code, startups and design is launching in Singapore in 2015. We've invited speakers to help inspire us to make this year about change and starting something new, whether it’s your own business, a new hobby, learning a new language or learning how to code. 
We proudly present our confirmed speakers. 
Grace Clapham 
 founder of The Change School. 
 
  
Jiawen Ngeow  
Founder of Megafash, a market place for independent brands 
 
  
 The event is hosted by the newest and hottest co-working space in Singapore The Working Capitol. 
 

  
Why should you attend? 
GeekGirl Meetup aim to highlight female role models by inviting them to take the stage and share their expertise, knowledge and inspire others to learn new skills with the focus on tech and business. 
A Geek Girl Meetup is all about meeting other likeminded girls and women to team up with to start working on fun and intresting projects.  
The GeekGirl community was founded in Sweden in 2008 and has from there spread to Denmark, Germany, Mexico, the US, the UK, and Hong Kong. The Geek Girl Singapore team currently consists of Erica Hanson, Katie Evans and Magdalena Krön. If you're intrested in getting involved send us an e-mail on geekgirlmeetupsg@gmail.com. 
Follow us us on twitter and like us on Facebook. 
geekgirlmeetup.com | Geek Girl Meetup Global geekgirlmeetup.co.uk | GeekGirl Meetup UK
events.location: The Working Capitol, 1 Keong Saik road, Singapore 089109

events.name: .NET Developers Meetup #2 : Developing Web
events.description: Hi .NETers, We will have our second .NET Developers Community Singapore meetup. Please join this meetup. There will be .NET news, coding, etc. sharing from the community and expert as well. We are very excited that this meet up will be at held at The Colony at *SCAPE, our Programme Partner. Direction : If you are using a bus, you can alight at Nat'l Youth Council bus stop (bus number: 7, 14, 16, 36, 65, 77, 106, 111, 123, 174, 174e, 175, 971E) and just cross the road. If you are using MRT, you can alight at Somerset MRT station (NS23) first and 5 minutes walk to the venue. Nearby landmark: Cineleisure Orchard . AGENDA • Latest news on .NET Open Source (open floor sharing). Try .NET... • Setting up ASP.NET MVC . See how you prepare setting up ASP.NET MVC. Migrating packages.config to project.json for server packages, using bower instead of nuget to fetch client libraries, using grunt instead of build script to compile typescript and less and to run JavaScript unit test, setting up MVC, Web API and SignalR and using Kestrel to run the application on a Linux VM. - by Nguyen Quy Hy • Dependency Injection with .NET MVC/WebAPI . Dependency injection is a powerful and fundamental software design pattern to building loosely coupled, highly unit testable software. Explore the 3 main ways of dependency injection (Constructor, Setter, Interface) and look at a simple and practical approach towards implementing IoC for any .NET MVC/WEB API project. - by Donovan Huang • Creating your own website using ASP.NET MVC 5 + AngularJS from 0 to go live . You can just learn or you can follow to create the website and add public domain name. I buy the domain from Namecheap.com , quite cheap only $3.98 per year. The presentation is fully step-by-step walk through, so by the end of the presentation, your own website will go live. You can update your own website easily from Visual Studio. I'm going to use angulargo template to create the website or someones template if more interesting. You need to bring your laptop if you want to follow me step-by-step. - by Riza What else... • Food will be available, thanks to from Microsoft Singapore. • YES!!! the Door Prize from unnamed sponsor for one lucky member, is this WD for you...???
events.location: *SCAPE The Colony, #04-01, 2 Orchard Link, Singapore 237978

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm ArtScience Museum Lobby The full line-up of ArtScience Late until January 2015 can be viewed here:http://bit.ly/artsciencelate For one evening a month, ArtScience Museum transforms into a night-time platform for artists in the fields of performance and new media to experiment, explore, discover and challenge their artistic boundaries. Come to a space where interaction, collaboration and experimentation are de rigueur of the night, and chill out with music and our bar overlooking Marina Bay. Hypermnesia 8pm & 9pm featuring Composit formed by Shunsuke Francois Nanjo (Japan/France), Kensuke Christophe Nanjo (Japan/France) and Nicolas Charbonnier (France) in collaboration with Eisa Jocson (The Philippines) The installation Hypermnesia is the result of artists and an aeronautical engineer working together. The team has developed for this unique occasion an interactive pole installation for the internationally celebrated choreographer/performer Eisa Jocson. The artwork will react to her body heat and movement, and the audience is also invited to interact with the artwork through touch, altering the sound in the background. Entry is complimentary and on a first come first served basis.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Run Ahead of the Game
events.description:
Play the game, the way it’s meant to be played. 
Streamline your business for accelerated growth, improved operational visibility and efficiency,  and increased customer loyalty. 
Join us for an exclusive seminar on 30 Jan 2015, 9am. 
REGISTER 
You are cordially invited to attend our free seminar, “Run Ahead of the Game”. 
As your business grows, so does the importance of visibility across your business processes.  Without it, you run the risk of compliance issues, poor quality data, and losing hard-earned  market share. Sidestep the common mistakes that expanding businesses often make, before they impact  your performance. If your business is growing, this could be the most important seminar you will attend in 2015. In  one morning, you will learn how to: 
• Improve operational visibility • Increase efficiency while increasing output • Accelerate growth • Increase customer satisfaction and loyalty 
Agenda 9.00am Registration & Breakfast 9.45am Welcome address 10.00am Run Ahead of the Game Speaker: Mr. Arun John, Regional Business Solutions Manager, Alenu IT Business Solutions 10.30am Tea Break 11.00am HP Server Infrastructure for SAP Speaker: Mr. Danny Tay, HP Server Category Manager, Hewlett-Packard Singapore 11.30am Capitalising on Government Grants and Schemes to decrease your IT expenses Speaker: Mr, Calvin Koh, Business Consultative Advisor, SME Centre@SCCCI 12.00pm End of Event

events.name: Rails Girls Meetup (January)
events.description: First Rails Girls of the year! Join us to pick up a new skill. Rails Girls meetup is an avenue to introduce women to the wonderful language of Ruby and the awesome framework, Ruby on Rails. Learning how to program might seem daunting (it really isn't) but don't worry, we are here to help you along. Instead of a fixed curriculum delivered classroom-style, Rails Girls meetup gives you the flexibility to choose what you want to do. There will be coaches around to answer any problems you have. If you have no idea where to start, we'll guide you through that too! (And yes, everything is hands-on.) Here are some suggestions of what you can choose to do: 1. Install Rails in your computer 2. Continue with your work on the Rails Girls app and perhaps follow some of the additional guides on http://guides.railsgirls.com/app/ , 3. Do the RailsBridge curriculum at http://docs.railsbridge.org/intro-to-rails/ 4. Work on your own project/learning material Please choose one of the options above when you RVSP. ---------- FAQs ---------- I haven't attended any previous Rails Girls events. Can I still join in this one? Absolutely! We can help you start with the Rails Girls app if you did not attend the last workshop. What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! But we are not providing any food/coffee. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Rails Girls is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcomed as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! Event is full! What should I do? Join the waitlist! We'll let you know when a new slot becomes available. Also, please update your RVSP if your plans have changed. Someone will really appreciate your slot. :) I'm a professional Rails Developer, can I be a coach? Yes, we are always looking for Ruby/Rails experts to help! Please drop us an email at elisha@learnemy.com or stania@thoughtworks.com and DO NOT RSVP to this event. Confirmed coaches: - TBC Can my company sponsor Rails Girls meetup? Thank you for helping us build an awesome community! If your company would like to sponsor this meetup, please get in touch with Elisha (elisha@learnemy.com) and Tania (stania@thoughtworks.com).
events.location: ThoughtWorks, 87B Amoy Street #03/04, Singapore 069906

events.name: ADVANCED R TRAINING by Jared Lander
events.description: The Revolution Analytics’ Center of Excellence (COE) is a collaboration with the Infocomm Development Authority of Singapore (IDA) to enable Singapore companies and professionals with training and expertise for big data analytics projects. We are pleased to host Professor Lander in Singapore from 2nd to 6th Feb 2015 for public class trainings and workshops. Jared P. Lander is a long-time Revolution Analytics consultant and collaborator, and the Founder and CEO of Lander Analytics. He is also the Organizer of the New York Open Statistical Programming Meetup and an Adjunct Professor of Statistics at Columbia University. With a masters from Columbia University in statistics and a bachelors from Muhlenberg College in mathematics, he has experience in both academic research and industry. He specializes in data management, multilevel models, machine learning, generalized linear models, data management, visualization and statistical computing. He is the author of R for Everyone, a book about R Programming geared toward Data Scientists and Non-Statisticians alike. The book is available from Amazon , Barnes & Noble and InformIT . The material is drawn from the classes he teaches at Columbia and is incorporated into his corporate training. Very active in the data community, Jared is a frequent speaker at conferences, universities and meetups around the world. He was a member of the 2014 Strata New York selection committee.
events.location: Revolution Analytics Singapore Office, 51 Changi Business Park Central 2 #04-09/10

events.name: Pre-Hackathon Workshop, Manpower Hackathon
events.description:
The Pre-Hackathon Workshop is a great opportunity for you to get a headstart for the Manpower Hackathon and immerse yourself in the themes with help from subject-matter experts.   
Learn from individuals working closely with local and foreign workers about the issues they face.  Use this to find out how your solutions can help empower these workers, making them aware of employment laws. Similarly, get an in-depth understanding of the opportunities available for technology-enabled tools to help instill the importantance of WSH and design the Next Generation Work Pass.   
Insights into the themes will come in handy when building your solutions during the hackathon weekend! 
  
EVENT DETAILS 
Date: Tuesday, 3 February 2015 
Time: 6.30 - 9pm 
Venue: 237 South Bridge Road 
  
MORE INFORMATION

events.name: 3D Printing Excellence with CATIA V5
events.description:
Learn how to 3D design an mechanical component using CATIA Advanced Surface capabilities. Learn from the live demonstration how you can apply advanced techniques to create high quality, aesthetically pleasing and geometrically accurate Surface 3D CAD data. 
Be intrigued on how 3D printing can improve and enhance your business workflow both in time compression and cost savings, and understand how you can translate a concept into a physical prototype within hours. 
Gain insights from experienced professionals on the latest in 3D printing application and various post-process methods in converting your prototype for actual end-use.  
Agenda 





Start 


End 


Agenda 


Guest Speaker 




0830 


0900 


Registration 


  




0900 


0915 


Opening Introduction 


Sean Looi General Manager Creatz3D Pte Ltd 




0915 


1015 


CATIA V5 – 3D Modelling and Demonstration 


Donald Koh Sales Director/Consultant TecMaven Group Pte Ltd

Li Chen Pre-Sales and Application Engineer Creatz3D Pte Ltd

3D Printing Applications and Post Processes 


Stanley Leung Pre-Sales and Application Manager Stratasys AP Ltd  




1215

Closing 


Sean Looi General Manager Creatz3D Pte Ltd 




1240 


1330 


Lunch & Networking Session 


  




This seminar is catered towards engineers, designers and business owners of all levels in the Aerospace as well as Precision Engineering industry. Join us at this exclusive event and uncover the different applications of 3D printing for you. 
Speakers 
  




  
Stanley Leung 
Pre-Sales & Application Manager 
Stratasys Singapore Pte Ltd 
  


Stanley Leung is the Pre-sales & Application Manager of South Asia, responsible for the technical sales support across the region of South East Asia, Australia and India to ensure sustainable implementation of 3D printing to the field. 
Prior to joining Stratasys, Stanley worked for a distributor under Objet AP Ltd. as a project executive, which owns various 3D printers including SLS, SLA, Objet, Zcorp and MLS in a period of 1.5 years. This is the start of his printing career. 
Stanley joined Objet AP Ltd. in 2011 and assumed the position of a Pre-Sales & Application Engineer for regions of Korea, Taiwan & Japan.  With vast experience on prospect visiting, 3d printing solution consultation and new application implement to the fields, Stanley developed a high-level of expertise and know-how with all that is related to company’s products and in-depth understanding on benefit of implementing  3D printing solution to industries. 
After the merger of Stratasys & Objet in December 2012, Stanley has played an important role in conducting numerous product & application training sessions to new partners. His contribution to strengthen penetration of 3D printing in the field had been recognized by the company and was assigned to be the Pre-sales Manager of South Asia in May 2014. 
Stanley holds a Bachelor Degree in Material Engineering from the Hong Kong City University. 
  




  
Sean Looi 
General Manager 
Creatz3D Pte Ltd. 
  


Sean Looi is the General Manager of Creatz3D Pte Ltd, the authorised distributor of Stratasys™ 3D printing systems and materials in Singapore, Vietnam and Indonesia. Creatz3D’s additive manufacturing solutions also includes Arcam™ for production of metal components as well as Materialise™ Rapid Prototyping Softwares. 
Despite majoring in MSc Finance, Sean’s passion in 3D printing opened the door of opportunity of distributing 3D printing technologies in 2007. His knowledge in various manufacturing practices placed him in favourable position to advice on advanced solutions for direct digital manufacturing. 
Sean’s accumulated technical experience with a variety of different 3D printing machines, technologies and applications, across all industry sectors, helped him to gain foresights into the macro economy of additive manufacturing potential. 
In return, Sean has been actively helping companies various sectors think more critically, innovate better to improve workflow and is highly respected in the local Additive Manufacturing committee. With over 6 years of experience in the industry, Sean is a regular invited keynote speaker in various local institutions and events. 
  




  
Sally Chuen 
Sales Manager, Singapore 
Creatz3D Pte Ltd. 


 Sally Chuen is the Sales Manager of Creatz3D Pte Ltd, an authorized distributor of Stratasys products in Singapore, Indonesia and Vietnam. She holds a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration from the University of South Australia, as well as a background education in Chemical Process Technology. 
Sally’s 9 years of past sales experiences revolves around the distribution of equipment in the production and manufacturing industries. She further diversified her portfolio into various other industries following her inception into Creatz3D in 2012 to promote the adoption of Objet 3D Printers.   
In 2013, Sally took the company forward by driving the demand and adoption of additive manufacturing in Singapore. With her background and understanding of the market, Sally currently heads her sales team to advocate the applications of 3D Printing. 
Sally has vast knowledge in 3D printing technologies and their various applications, and she is no stranger to sharing her advices with audiences. 




  
Donald Koh 
Sales Director/Consultant 
TecMaven Group Pte Ltd 


Donald Koh is the Sales Director/Consultant with TecMaven Group Pte Ltd and has over 20 years of Technical Sales experience/knowledge across different Mechanical and Manufacturing software solutions.   
Previously a Mechanical/ Manufacturing Engineer, Donald has helped many companies across different industries with individual Mechanical and Manufacturing requirement. 
Together with Keith Tan, Senior Application Engineer with 14 years of CATIA experience at Tecmaven Group, they will be presenting the power of CATIA V5 Mechanical and Surface Design solution and as well as downstream application to 3D Printing. 




  
Who Should Attend 

3D CAD/CAM Designers
Automotive Engineers
Mechanical Engineers
Business Owners and Decision Makers

Terms and Conditions 

Online registration is required.
Each participant is allowed to order one (1) ticket only.
Registration closes on 3rd February 2015, or when seats are filled.
Organizers reserve the right to the final decision regarding all registration matters

Further information, contact Nigel at 9388 0512 to find out more. 
Alternatively, you can email info@creatz3d.com to inquire.

events.name: Drone Fun Inaugural Meetup
events.description: Bring your drones and let's have fun! Open to suggestions on activities / challenges, but here're are some ideas (still figuring out rules to keep it safe for our drones!): 1. Oval course racing, 1 on 1 and/or fleet 2. Obstacle course time trials (fly through hoops etc...) 3. Drone 'basketball' - 1 on 1 fly through the hoop before your opponent to score points Don't forget to bring all your spare batteries, and chargers, and bringing cold beers also encouraged! N.B. This is all 'weather permitting', if the weather looks sketchy, then we'll relocate to somewhere nearby for coffee or something... I'll post an update earlier on in the day if it's a NG.

events.description: Saturday 7 February, 2.30pm – 5pm Presented by Forum for the Future FREE Imagining the Future An afternoon of fascinating talks exploring what the future may look like in Singapore and beyond, with opportunities for questions and discussion. This session is developed by Forum for the Future in partnership with ArtScience Museum. Featuring four speakers who bring different perspectives on the future: • Veerappan Swaminathan, Co-founder, Sustainable Living Lab • Tong Yee, Co-founder, The Thought Collective • Prof Dr Peter Edwards, Director, Singapore ETH Centre • Michelle Lim, Founder, Singapore National Ceramics Festival The session will be chaired by James Goodman, Director of Futures at Forum for the Future.

What is IaaS, PaaS, SaaS. + How to create Microsoft Azure account : And get a free USD200 credits to spend on all Azure services. + Introduction to Microsoft Azure: Cloud ecosystem and portal navigation. + Azure at a glance for Developers : I'm a developer (.NET, Java, Node.js, PHP, etc.), what should I do to use Azure? + Create my own WordPress blogger in the cloud . My server, my database, my control. + Q&A and Closing WiFi: Free Food and Drinks: Available

events.name: Learning Haskell and using Yesod as a production API backend by @Calvin Cheng
events.description: Haskell is an obscure language in comparison with other popular languages/frameworks like python/django, ruby/rails, javascript/nodejs and is usually not considered in 'mainstream' start-up projects. I decided to take a look and found it an impressive language that I am comfortable using, for a new production app in my company. Our current app uses golang for the API backend. I would like to share my experiences (and pain :-p) learning the language and why I am happy with it as our API backend for a new app.

events.name: Reduce Manufacturing Defects and Scrap with Schematic Creation to Your 3D Electrical Designs
events.description:
Take your electrical schematics to the next dimension SolidWorks Electrical 3D enables you to use your schematic data from SolidWorks Electrical with your overall mechanical design, opening up a new level of productivity. Concurrent design between electrical and mechanical teams can now be a reality—in real time. You can collaborate easily and naturally, optimize the overall product design, and streamline development.  
  
Key capabilities include: 

Real-time bi-directional updates between 2D and 3D synchronize electromechanical design so everything stays coordinated throughout development
Integration of the 2D schematic with the 3D model helps standardize designs and unify your BOMs to reduce mistakes and delays
Placement of the electrical system and cables/wires in your 3D model enables planning of specific locations and paths for consistent product manufacturing

 



  
EVENT TITLE 
Reduce Manufacturing Defects and Scrap with Schematic Creation to Your 3D Electrical Designs 
  
WHO SHOULD ATTEND 
Electrical Engineers, Middle Management and other Engineers who want to learn about SolidWorks Electrical (2D & 3D Integration) and how ATE will value add in meeting engineering challenges.

events.name: Big Data for Social Good Challenge (See Details for Start/End)
events.description: THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE BEGINS NOVEMBER 10, 2014 AND CONTINUES TO MARCH 3, 2015. CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service . Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found. Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded.... Register here: http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/ What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix. Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page . The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size. Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets !
events.location: Big Data for Social Good Challenge, Web only, Singapore

events.name: Lets meet at Cloud Conference in Singapore
events.description: Cloud computing continues to be the way of the future and many studies indicate that more than 50% of all information technology will be in this new paradigm within the next five to ten years. This transformation has great implications for emerging markets which have the potential to leap frog mature markets in their adoption of cloud computing, combine cloud computing and mobile technologies to introduce unique services that can transform the lives of billions, drive a much larger scale of adoption and challenge existing price points, while presenting unique challenges in areas such as security and user interfaces to cloud computing. Theme : Cloud Computing: Opportunities, Issues, and Challenges & Big Data Innovation: Driving Business Success. Key Topics - Cloud Computing- Mindset, Business and Technology Chang - Designing Infrastructure for Enterprises on Public Cloud - Panel Discussion : Sharing Resources on cloud value - - - Development Model and Environment for Dynamic Mobile Cloud Services - Security of Virtual Working on Cloud Computing Platform - Local Authentication and Authorization System for Immediate Setup of Cloud Environments - Cloud Champions League, Switzerland - Final Corporate Quiz Benefits of attending • Increased speed in responding to unforeseen events. • Easy to get the latest and greatest updates. • Adoption is quick and simple. • Improved information security. • Deployment time decreases from years to months. events.name: Lets meet at Internet of Things in Singapore
events.description: Our Conferences focuses on latest happening in IoT and how the Internet of Things will re-shape our interactions with the real and virtual worlds in the coming years. This Conference brings together leading IoT companies, Start-Ups and the developer/ Professional community to exchange their ideas with the practical application and utilization of Internet of Things. This event shall provide you the opportunity to meet IoT experts, Start Ups, attend keynote presentation and interactive sessions and network with experienced Business and Technical practitioners and Start Ups in the area of IoT. Theme: Link your World", exploring the latest happening in IoT Industry and how the Internet of Things will offer businesses and consumers. IoT Conference focus on:- - Keynote: Everywhere, Everything & Everyone - How IoT Platform & Knowledge Graphics are Changing the Way We Live & Work - Convergence of Network, Services & Devices: Regulatory & Policy Framework -Software Frameworks and Environment for IoT - Internet of Things as a key Technology Accelerator -?How Mobility Transform Your Business with IoT - Radio Spectrum for the IoT: a Critical Challenge - How to Identify Patterns for Machine-to-Machine Solutions with the Cloud - Central Monitoring and Troubleshooting of IoT Networks: Meeting the SLA Challenge For agenda click here Why Implementing the Internet of Things - Greater visibility into operations: The biggest benefit to implementing IoT is greater visibility into machine operation and plant performance. Industries have been collecting massive amounts of data for years, but it’s been a challenge to analyze this data so that it can lead to actionable items. - M2M: integral step to IoT: One of the ways to see how IoT is becoming a reality is by looking at machine-to-machine (M2M) technologies. M2M refers to machines communicating directly to other equipment without any human intervention, usually through real-time controllers and HMIs. M2M is also an integral step in the development of IoT. - Leveraging existing technologies for interoperability - Tangible results - Benefits from the cloud Benefits of Internet of things • Tracking behavior for real-time marketing; • Enhanced situational awareness; • Sensor-driven decision analytics; • Process optimization; • Optimized resource consumption; and • Instantaneous control and response in complex autonomous systems. • Ubiquitous networks • Connected computing • Ubiquitous sensors • Intelligence at the periphery of the network • Analytics-as-a-Service • Marketing automation • Supply Chain Analytics Audience for the Conference 2014 (Not limited to) - Start-Up in IoT and M2M, and have any product to showcase or any idea to share. - Venture Capitalist, and want to support IoT Start-Ups. - Professional, and works in the area of IoT and M2M - Researcher and want to see latest happening in the area of IoT. - Student and want to enhance your knowledge. For More detail click here For online registration click here For offline registration, please send the following details to [masked] Name | Email ID | Contact No | Designation | Organization Name For this meet up group 10% discount on registration fee

events.name: Hebocon Singapore (Robotics competition for the technically ungifted)
events.description: The search for Singapore's worst robot will take place some time this year (most likely in July 2015). Known as Japan’s "worst robot competition”, the purpose of the HEBOCON event is to find out which crappy robot is the ultimate failure of them all through a sumo-styled wrestling battle. Preparations are being made to bring this quirky robotic competition to Singapore. We are looking for venue hosts, sponsors, contributors and supporters for this inaugural event. More details about guidelines and rules of competition will be announced in March 2015. Meanwhile stay cute and unskillful! If you're interested to participate, please indicate your attendance here. Thank you. *the date indicated below is a tentative one. the confirmed schedule will be release in Mar 2015 For more information about HEBOCON, check out the official page at https://www.facebook.com/Hebocon.Official
